resources.string: Regex Matcher allows a user to check if an input line of text matches a user-defined regex (regular expression). Regex Matcher will show what matches were found against the regex, and what position the matches occurred at in your input text.
If you have any questions, suggestions, or bugs to report, send me an email.

Special Characters:

 \\ - Backslash (must be escaped)


Character Classes:

 [a-z] - Any lower case letter
 [A-Z] - Any upper case letter
 [^yc] - Any character other than y or c
 [0-9a-fA-F] - Any single digit integer, or any character from a-f (lower-case and upper-case)


Predefined Character Classes

 . - Any character
 \d - A digit [0-9]
 \D - Any character other than a digit [^0-9]
 \s - A White-space character: space, tab, end-line, etc
 \S - Any character other than a white-space character
 \w - A word character [a-zA-Z_0-9]
 \W - Any character other than a word character


Multiplicity

 X? - X, zero or one times
 X+ - X, one or more times
 X* - X, zero or more times


Regex Matcher uses Java's Pattern class, full information on what regex is supported can be found at: http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html
